Class javachart.chart.StackBar 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----javachart.chart.Bar
           |
           +----javachart.chart.StackColumn
                   |
                   +----javachart.chart.StackBar
public class StackBar
extends StackColumn
Subclass of StackColumn to stack bars horizontally

StackBar(Dataset[], AxisInterface, AxisInterface, Plotarea)
Constructs a new StackBar based on the specified array of Datasets, which are scaled by the specified X Axis and Y Axis, and bounded by the specified Plotarea Draws Datasets in horizontally arranged bars, with one color per Dataset, specified by the Dataset Gc.

buildDataXfm()
Overrides Bar xfm to swap axes
doBar(Graphics, double, int, int, boolean)
Overrides Bar to draw horizontal stacks, called by doBars
doBarLabel(Graphics, double, int, int)
Overrides Bar to draw labels appropriate for horizontally stacked bars
doDBar(Graphics, double, int, int, boolean)
Overrides Bar to draw horizontal stacks with a dimensional effect, called by doBars

StackBar 
  public StackBar(Dataset d[],
                  AxisInterface xAx,
                  AxisInterface yAx,
                  Plotarea subplot)
Constructs a new StackBar based on the specified array of Datasets, which are scaled by the specified X Axis and Y Axis, and bounded by the specified Plotarea Draws Datasets in horizontally arranged bars, with one color per Dataset, specified by the Dataset Gc. Multiple Datasets are stacked one upon another.
Parameters:
d - Array of Dataset classes to consider
xAx - Axis to scale X data
yAx - Axis to scale Y data
subplot - Plotarea bounding this StackBar

buildDataXfm 
  protected void buildDataXfm()
Overrides Bar xfm to swap axes
